intro: Galium hypadenium, commonly known as the narrowleaf bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20 to 60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Galium hypadenium is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
